newsitem.title: SPAIN: Repsol shares hit record as sale nears end.
newsitem.headline: Repsol shares hit record as sale nears end.

text.p: Shares in Repsol SA hit a new record high on Monday as the sale of the government's final 10.0 pct stake in Spain's energy group enters its final week.

By 1250 GMT, the share had risen 20 pesetas, or 0.32 percent, to 6,320 pesetas, just off a new high set earlier at 6,330 and broadly in line with the market. The IBEX-35 index was up 24.95, or 0.44 percent, at 5,653.09.
"After the highs, Repsol should behave less well than the rest of the market, at least during this week," said a dealer at a brokerage that is participating in the privatisation.
The holding company for the state's remaining stake, the State Society for Industrial Stakes (SEPI) will fix the maximum price for the retail tranche of the sale.
To fix the maximum, SEPI may not exceed any of the average prices of Repsol in the last five bourse sessions.
Up to now, to highest of the average prices was 6,252, hit on Friday. This price was surpassed this morning, but the day's average price will not be known until the close.
The period for provisional share orders from small investors ended at 1200 GMT on Monday, and irrevocable share orders can be made from April 22-25.
